utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's a pretty fast clip.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Fantastic right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Kennedy?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Yes, it is National Bourbon Day, that's right. Party people the most American drink has its own day, so let's make a Kentucky Mule. Not a Moscow Mule, because they are not our friends. All right. So what I do, I muddle lime and mint and then muddle, muddle, muddle, muddle. I add ice. I am using Michter's. So we'll put some Michter's in here.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Beauty.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: A little bit with love. And how do you finish off a Kentucky Mule, friends, you are all asking? With some ginger beer.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: So look at that. It is refreshing. It is summery and it is all Americans.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It is best--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's what I will hear. All right. Cheers, America. That's it for us tonight. We'll see you back here on Monday. Have a great weekend! utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.utterance: Hello, everybody. I'm Jesse Watters along with Kennedy, Juan, Dana, and Tom. It's 5 o'clock in New York City. And this is “The Five.” President Trump raging against Democrats and House Speaker Nancy Pelosi after she accused his administration of engaging in a, quote, "criminal cover-up." Pelosi's attack coming in response to Trump saying he would be open to hearing dirt on his 2020 opponent from a foreign government. The president clarifying those comments earlier today.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.utterance: If I was -- and of course, you have to look at it because if you don't look at it, you're not going to know if it's bad. Of course, you give it to the FBI or report it to the attorney general or somebody like that. But, of course, you do that. You couldn't have that happen with our country. If I thought anything was incorrect or badly stated, I would report it to the attorney general, the FBI. I would report it to law enforcement, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Trump coming out swinging against Pelosi's absurd accusation and pointing the finger back at the speaker and her own party.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: This is probably the worst or certainly one of the worst political scandals in the history of our country. They spied on the opposing party's campaign using the intelligence apparatus of the United States. It's a fascist statement. It's a disgraceful statement. I call her nervous Nancy. She is a nervous wreck. If you look at what happened, Hillary Clinton, with the money that ultimately went to Russia for the fake dossier, that total fake pile of stuff, the amount of money that was paid and paid by Hillary Clinton and the DNC and it went to Russia, that's the criminal.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He also blasted the ongoing congressional investigations into the Mueller report calling them unfair.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Isn't it amazing that constantly every day somebody gets a letter, come into Congress, come into Congress. Because you know, it's like death through 1,000 wounds. And I will tell you, it's so unfair what they are doing. And I really think that people are wise to it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Seems like we always come back, Dana, to Trump and nervous Nancy Pelosi.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: They are going to, it's a show down right to the finish.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: A showdown again on a Friday. A criminal cover-up now, I guess, is the latest threat.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You heard it say of the Democrats. You know, you are going to have to put up some proof soon if you are going to keep doing this because they've already done the Mueller report. I don't see how -- I don't see how they come up with something else that is going to change people's minds. I just, I don't. I'd be willing to look at it, like foreign intelligence. I'll look at it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Maybe I will have to report it to the FBI. But honestly, when you have people who will whisper in your ear like, there really is something and then there is never something. Again, it does get very tiring. It's like, I understand why he is frustrated about it. The difficult thing is he feels like he has to continue to be on offense because he doesn't want to be on defense about it. But that means that is to the exclusion of everything else.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You can't talk about the economy. You can't run on the economy if the Democrats have figured out, they can make him talk about this every single day and make this the story, maybe they think that helps them. But it doesn't help me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Because he had an excellent --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It doesn't help me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- event the other day with Kim Kardashian and Sarah Sanders.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Why are you laughing? It's a great cause.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, Juan, if she was there --

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: He kept running a reality show.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If she was there at the Obama White House, we would be reading story --

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY MONTGOMERY, FOX BUSINESS HOST
utterances.utterance: Are you out of your mind?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- after story about how an amazing event this was.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, I would --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It was buried today.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what I would do? I you would tune in on the weekend to Watters World.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And he would mock Obama for having another reality show being so superficial. Am I doing it, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's not that bad, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK. Thank you, brother. Thank you, thank you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. So, you know, we are back to where we were yesterday.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, we are not.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: A hypothetical scandal.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, we're not. No, we're not.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What's new?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yesterday, I said to you --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What's that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- this guy just did something that was basically sounding to the American people, you know what, it doesn't matter if I cheat to get reelected, I'm going to do something illegal. You said, no, that's not true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's not what he said.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's not true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's not what he said.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And then today, he backpedaled. Now I'm thinking to myself, if he acknowledged that he said something that was wrong and he says to the American people, you know, of course, I would tell the FBI, of course, I wouldn't take dirt on my opponent from. I'm thinking, Jesse must think, yes, I guess Juan was right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I never think that. Because that's never happened. I think he said the other day; I'd listen and maybe I'd give it to the FBI.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Look, what you said --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But you still have not been able to answer the fact that Hillary paid for the foreign dossier.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Here we go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Trump never paid for anything, never got anything.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: This is so ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Hillary got it and paid for it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know why I like sitting next to you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Why?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because what aboutism is so obvious to the audience.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's called context, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You don't want to talk about --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's called context.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You don't want to talk about what's going on here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I have to do that because you don't acknowledge the other side. Kennedy.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: I will acknowledge both sides.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Please.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: I think it was a really foolish thing that the president said.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: And I don't think anyone to go out of their way to try and justify his remarks to George Stephanopoulos. I think he did enough damage to himself in this realm. And he needs to absolutely drop it. And what he said today, he should have said in that interview. But also, it's not what aboutism. You know, your issue is with the means and not the end. And it should be with the end. So, if the ultimate problem that we have is Russian operatives are trying to infiltrate campaigns in order to affect the outcome of elections, we should have a problem with that. But now, people like Andy McCabe, he is just worried about the means. Because he doesn't have a problem with intelligence laundering, which I think is incredibly problematic, because it went through a law firm and the DNC --

utterances.speaker: TOM SHILLUE, HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes, amazing. Amazing quote.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: And then a British operative. Like, that's OK, even though they paid millions of dollars to the same compromised people who were doing the exact same thing. You know, the only difference is, they got enriched in the process.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Those are the same people that Robert Mueller had an issue with. And the other thing about Nancy Pelosi --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me respond to that.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Well, no, I want to get to Nancy Pelosi.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Go ahead, go ahead.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: So, you got to keep a little lift.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: The other thing about Nancy Pelosi is with Robert Mueller, she is basically saying that he did a horrible job. And if this is a criminal cover-up and what the president said rises to level of impeachment, that's basically saying that Robert Mueller isn't competent.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No. Both sides in fact. Didn't Bill Barr say he expected that Robert Mueller would come to a conclusion especially in obstruction and he is disappointed that he didn't. He is saying the same thing that Pelosi said.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: No. He could have used much more forceful language.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. One of the funniest things about the interview, nervous Nancy, she is a nervous wreck. He is going to stick with this name and he is going to beat that drum for the rest of the term.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Yes. He likes nervous Nancy. Although, I mean, she is not running against him. The important nicknames are the ones he is going to be running against, I think. But I agree that quote by McCabe is amazing. And this is why it's good that Trump is doing his own fighting. He gets out in these talk shows and he keeps saying this is the biggest criminal conspiracy ever against my presidency. And it was this, what a crazy person. It's conspiracy theories. Andrew McCabe, what he said was something a right-wing talk show host would say. He said, for a campaign to hire a law firm, an American law firm it turns out it hires another American research company who contracts out with a foreign individual, this is Andy McCabe, and he says that's not illegal. That's fine. That's just swamp at work. It's unbelievable. They're all admitting to what happened. But they are saying, no, no, that's the way we do it in Washington.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I can't believe the media can talk about this pseudo scandal with the hypothetical thing that Trump said or he did say or he would say or he wouldn't do. And you literally had Hillary Clinton moving nine million to the DNC, to the law firm, to the foreign national from the U.K., who gets all of the dirt from --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK. Let me --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- Russian political operatives --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: This is so --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Russian intelligence officials and Russian government officials.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Excuse me, can I --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So that is literally paying for foreign dirt.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's not right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And the media is not even talking about that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I wonder why, maybe --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Why, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- your fevered dream has --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Why do you think they're not?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because you're having a fevered dream. And let me just tell you guys --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, wake me up. What's that, what's the key point?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Even with the Steele dossier that you guys are fixating on, guess what he did? He reported it to the FBI.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Who did?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Steele.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, no. He did this, Juan. He took it and he gave it to Bruce Ohr --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No. My God.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- at the State Department.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What is the --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And what did he do with it? What did he do with it?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Because Bruce Ohr's wife worked for Fusion GPS.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK. So, in other words --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, what they did they (Inaudible) through the administration.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He gave it to the government, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Was he giving it to the government for what reason, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right. Yes. Because he said --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Because he wanted to wiretap the president.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No. Because he said it's alarming that elections --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's alarming.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- maybe able --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He paid Russians to tell him lies about Trump.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, no.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And then he gave it to the government and said, hey, guys, Trump did some nasty stuff in a hotel. You might want to look into that? And even the government said this doesn't seem right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let's keep your sex life out of this.

utterances.speaker: MONTHGOMERY
utterances.utterance: But Juan, why don't we --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I am saying to you --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Boy, we're safe.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- that what we got here is the president of the United States saying he would take dirt from a foreign power. You guys are saying, Hillary did the same thing. Of course not. We've got opposition research in American history.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Well, I mean, --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not only did she take it, she paid for it.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Yes. And doesn't it make the president so --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, so did a conservative newspaper that first page Fusion GPS.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: I mean, doesn't it goes to show that the president is a little bit more frugal? And Hillary Clinton has to wait from --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right. A dirt is expensive, especially the foreign stuff.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. Are we good?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: We need a chalk board.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. The first 2020 Democrat debate stage is officially set. So, who does Trump want to face off against? Hear from him next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The race is on. The first presidential debate stage has officially been set. So, 20 Democratic candidates are not set to take the stage with the debates split between two nights, June 26th and June 27th. The dual nights are needed to accommodate this large field. And the president not holding back on what he thinks of his potential competitors slamming Joe Biden and other 2020 hopefuls. Watch.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Everybody knows that Joe Biden does not have what it takes. OK. He doesn't have what it takes. He ran two or three times. I used to call him 1 percent Joe, because he never got more than 1 percent. Then Obama came along and surprisingly took him off of, I say, the trash heap. And ran. But everybody knows Joe is -- doesn't have it. Now I see that Pocahontas is doing better. I would love to run against her, frankly. I see that Bernie Sanders is not doing well at all. I would have frankly liked to have run against -- I think it's probably those three.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Mayor Pete, I don't see at all. I think that's a joke. Mayor Pete.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Anyway, I've heard it before. But now the Daily Beast is looking ahead to a possible defeat for the president and asking the question, what if Trump won't leave the White House? Si that, are they throwing in the towel, Kennedy, already?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: He might never leave. And squatter's rights. That's the problem. The law is on his side. What if he doesn't leave? What if he is reelected? Then what?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Then what, boy.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: You got a double impeachment if he has a second term. I don't understand this. You know, you talk about what aboutism. And my issue is what if-isms. Because you know, what if -- and sometimes these things never materialize. And you waste so much time and energy and emotional and mental resources --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Never answer a hypothetical.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: -- on this garbage.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: And maybe the president should have learned that from his --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It is always good advice. What do you think about these two debate nights that are coming up for the Democrats? They were chosen at random. Elizabeth Warren, basically, kind of has this first night and a bunch of others. And then you have the second night with Kamala Harris and Biden and Bernie all on the same stage.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, it looks like they stacked it. And I'm happy with it because that's the top tier --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't think they stack. They say they didn't stack. They said it was random and campaign representatives were there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. I still believe it was stacked. But I think listen, Liz Warren, it could go either way. She could either feel like she is left out and everyone is going to be punching up and attacking her constantly or she could shine and she could really come out in the media all says, Liz Warren, you know, obviously, cleaned up --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- in that first debate. She is a top-tier candidate. But that other debate, that's a hot debate. I don't know how they are going to put them next to each other. But I mean, it's going to get ugly. There's not a lot of lower tier candidates for them to attack. Do you all go after Biden or do you go after Bernie, since Bernie is kind of that liberal socialist who has the inside track?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is the other thing. They have one minute to answer and 30 seconds to follow up. That's not --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Politicians can't do that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's not enough time.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: No, no. And it's a -- you don't learn anything from this except who, you know, landed a punch or whatever it happens to be. I feel bad for the four. There's only four that didn't make it, right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Those are the really sad ones. Give the -- what they should do --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But they have a chance to make it to the second one.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Well, first of all, they should do like a booze cruise or something that night.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: And you know, something with --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Or MST3000.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Or have a rally in Wisconsin.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: You could have them all watching it have a live look at the four --

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Absolutely. They've got to do something. The four of them team up.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: That's great.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: And they could be, you know, like it come back with it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Juan --

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Because they were unfairly knocked out because everyone and his brother is doing the debate.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, they would say it's not unfair that they have known what the rules were since last January. I think the DNC said these are -- these are the metrics that you are going to have to hit in order to make these debates.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Just to be clear, it's 1 percent in three polls or 65,000 unique donors.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: After one, though. Like, let them have one debate and maybe they would.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes. You guys --

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: And maybe some of these other big shots you get knocked down.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You can still run. It's just that you didn't make the debate stage because they set a clear criteria as Dana was saying. And let me get back to the president and his comments on Fox & Friends. clearly, Joe Biden is living rent-free in his head.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Squatter's right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because all he wants to do is talk about Joe Biden.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: He can't kick him out.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: To talk about Joe Biden to know. And I just think, you know, he knows like a poker player who can't hide his tail. He knows from his own pollster that Biden is beating him all over the place. So, he keeps talking about Biden. But I will say this. In terms of the debate, I can imagine Elizabeth Warren, I think Elizabeth Warren will have like Amy Klobuchar on one side and I don't know who else on the other. She is going to be the star of the first debate.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: In the second debate, you got four, I think four of THE FIVE Democrats who are polling more than 7 percent. It is going to be a real showdown.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But is it a risk for Elizabeth Warren, one, not to be in that other debate because, she's -- well, I guess they could say, she will do really well. And then in a way, I guess it pushes you to watch the July debate, which is about a month later, because, presumably, in that mix-up, she will be on the stage with a Biden or a Bernie.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I think what you get, Dana, is a situation where everybody is focused on Elizabeth Warren. Remember she is going to be in the middle of the stage, the person with the highest percentage they get the middle of the stage. So, Biden is on the second night, the middle stage first night is Elizabeth Warren.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: I think yes. To your point, I think they go after Biden. You know, and you --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Everyone is going to go after him.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Everyone is going to go Biden. They are not going to go after Bernie yet because they don't want to tear down socialists because they all want to run on that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: So, they are waiting for Bernie to make his own missteps so they can swoop in and take the progressive mojo. But I don't think anyone losses by attacking Biden and I think he is in for it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: And I don't know --

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: And I don't know that Warren gets attacked. But it is nice you will get to see some of the more random candidates, whether or not they are good debaters.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, you only get four --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Because you may have some standouts that you didn't even consider.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think the rule is that you get five minutes. Each gets a maximum five minutes for the entire show. Right?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It is unbelievable.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And so, the catnip is what do you do to get on Fox & Friends the next morning?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What can you do? Now you are going to think --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Steal the president's phone.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You are going to think that it's -- by the way, who is going to be the number one viewer of this? Donald Trump. He is going to be tweeting right in the middle.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And we are going to be following him live tweeting. And I agree. I think Biden will get hit. But Biden I don't think is articulate and sharp enough to jujitsu with his minute allotted and come across as sharp. Because we've seen him at these rallies. I watched the whole thing the other day, Juan, the whole 35 minutes of Biden in Iowa. Only 175 people showed up. He was not sharp. He was not smooth. He bored everybody to death. He was wonky. He didn't have it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You seem to think that --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And the TV cameras are on. You are going to have to be quick. And I don't think he has that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hey. hold on. Allow Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I just want to say that because Biden is doing well in these polls, I agree that the rally is like something like, it's not really a rally. It's just an event. But I think the Democrats seem to like that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I was going to say the same thing. Stability, rationality, why is that so appealing these days?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK. But let me ask you tis --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think enthusiasm, Juan. It's the critical factor when you're running for president. Enthusiasm.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Who does Biden go after? Let's say Biden goes on offense, let's say everyone is attacking him, you can't play defense the whole night. He can't just apologize for the crime bill which he doesn't really done.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: So, does he just attack the president? It does not look weird.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: If everyone is hey, Joe, tell us about your record. Well, Donald Trump is not American and an existential threat, am I right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That might be his only move though.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's what he is going to do.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's the front runner move.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I wonder if they are going to prevent crowd participation. You know, like, applaud and things.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I hate that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What do you think?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Well, that's what --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You can't stop it.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: You can't stop it, especially if the partisans are there, if the crowd is there. If the Bernie bros are there --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And there's going to be screaming.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, because the Bernie bros or the far-left guys and they are going to be the loudest. Biden might not get the crowd reaction that, you know, Bernie would get.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what I hear from Fox people who do these things, that the most difficult element to handle is the audience.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Because you know what they are going to do.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right. And you want to play to them a little bit.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Right. But I must say there is no plan to have the audience involved here. This is all about the moderators --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I know but --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- and the candidates.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But you can't prevent them from gasping or applauding or yelling.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's fine.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Rachel Maddow is going to have to shoos. A lot of shooshing (Ph).

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Centrism is not going to get the crowd going though. They are going to have to go left.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No. Not a lot of passion in centrism.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: In the California event, they were all booing.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes, are going to boo.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: They were all booing. Hickenlooper and the lady in the room they were like --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Sorry. You (Inaudible) primary and caucus in the wrong way.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: And the problem is not --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. Next, investigators say they think they know what's behind the death of several Americans in the Dominican Republic. We'll tell you what it is next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The mystery surrounding the deaths of several American tourists in the Dominican Republic is now getting a closer look. Investigators are reportedly testing hotel liquor that may have been altered or contained dangerous chemicals as well as investigating who supplied that alcohol. This is yet another family comes forward demanding answers after their 53- year-old mom, Leyla Cox, died while vacationing in the Dominican Republic. Cox apparently suffered a heart attack which is also what reportedly caused many of the other victim's death. So, Tom, are you going away this weekend?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: No. I'm not going away. I mean, I'm home. But I don't think Dominican Republic has been dealing with this well at all. I think it's a total disaster and they better get out in front of this whatever the reason. Because as of now, I will never go to that country. Now you could change my mind. But you have to put a put of effort into this, whatever it happens to be.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If someone paid for it, you would go.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Well, no. No, I would not.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: I would not. I will never go to the Dominican Republic.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You would go on boycott.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: And I bet a lot of Americans would say the same thing. And I'm imagining that a lot, a huge percentage of the income of the Dominican Republic is tourism. So, they better get on this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I have a theory. Here's my theory. This is Caribbean sabotage. There is competition amongst these islands for tourism dollars. The D.R. is really hot. They've been hot for about 10 years. They are getting a lot of vacationers going down there spending a lot of money.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Great cigars.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm not saying it's Puerto Rico, I'm not saying it's Aruba but maybe there is a network of saboteurs from a competing island that goes in --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wow. That --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- let me just finish. It's speculation. Goes in and they mess with the bottles in the minibar. Maybe they put a little here, they put a little there. All of a sudden, you have a huge, massive tourism catastrophe.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And nobody wants to go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No one wants to go. Maybe they will go to the Virgin Islands, maybe they'll go to the Caymans. You'll never know who's involved. I'm just saying.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This would be a good novel.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Possibility.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It would be a good novel

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This is my first novel.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Maybe.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: I mean, but it's tragic though. Because the D.R. is not handling this well with families to your point.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: And they want answers. And Leyla Cox's family has been told that the machines that test fluids for toxic substances are broken. They can't do toxicology tests apparently.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: God.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: So now, the FBI is working with law enforcement there. But talk about not getting behind the story. And you know, to your point about Aruba, I have a hard time thinking about going to Aruba, because I was so traumatized by the Natalee Holloway story --

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: -- watching that coverage, you know, year after year with no answers and the pain in her family.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Go to Puerto Rico. That island needs a lot of dollars. You could use it after the hurricanes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: And you can use American dollars.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And you can use American dollars there.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: And no passport.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right. So, Dana, back to reality. What they have discovered so far is that at the minibar in the rooms, and I know what you told me earlier about you don't drink from minibars, because they are so expensive.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Is that true?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, no, you should --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, because Peter got mad one time - well, he got mad, but he did - anyway I drain from the minibar. I didn't know how expensive it was. I was 25. Sorry.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK. But there's another reason, Dana, the police in the Dominican Republic, along with Peter--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: $15 - Dana--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think all the--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: In the nuts.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, My God. What is--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's the worse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's actually $12.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes. All right, anyway, Dana, that they have discovered that in fact in some of the alcohol bottles that were in the minibar, it didn't contain alcohol, but methanol, which is poisonous and so that could it be the resin that these people are then suffering heart attacks and seizures and dying.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK. So to Tom's point, how do they - how would you get ahead of this if you were the DR and tourism is your #1 industry and it employs a lot of people and it brings in a lot of dollars for you to be able to run your country. I think that they would say stop looking, listen we're doing a full investigation all the minibars out. Pour it all out. Start over, have a new regulation, so that they - remember that Johnson & Johnson crisis when the cyanide was in the tylenol bottles. What did they do? They didn't say, well, we're just fine and then like we're not really sure. Well really maybe - they just said, all of it off the shelves right now. And that's the only way to deal with--

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: And that's why you have child safety caps on all medications. It is because of the cyanide deaths. And you're absolutely right. I mean, they can find the perpetrators who tried to kill Big Papi. But they're stonewalling when it comes to this investigation and I don't know if it's a group of saboteurs, or if you have like a psychopath who is--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right, a serial killer--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He is gaining access to all the hotels, so I mean, he has to have some sort of money. He's going into these hotels, he's emptying out the liquor and pouring in the poison. I don't know. I think to your point, if they empty it all out, then you need a celebrity to come visit. You need the biggest celebrity to--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Jesse Watters - then you could go back and end the boycott.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's how I end the boycott. I go down there, I announce everything's fine. Everyone sees, Oh, Watters is going back.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And you know what they put in the minibar--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Redneck Riviera from John Rich.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I love it when a plan comes together.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: By the way, you mentioned what happened to David Ortiz, the baseball player, known as Big Papi, as Kennedy said. So they think they know that people were paid like $7,000 to do a hit job on him, but they don't know why. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Well, there has been some rumors - speculation. I don't know if I'm allowed--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You go right out there--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, heck, we've already given it a good go here.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Go ahead Kennedy.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: No, I have heard that he was fond, perhaps, of a man's wife and that man may in fact not be selling pharmaceuticals, but other substances that people take when their ailing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh My God. Oh My God. I have to worry about Peter and Dana. Now somebody out and he might kill me. We debated here for days if Belen should be allowed to vote? But what about serving on juries, Oh My Gosh, stay with us, that's next on “The Five.”

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: I don't know where my head is. It's right here. First it was voting rights of felons, but apparently that wasn't enough. Now Democrats want them to be able to serve on juries. The most recent push, coming out of California, in Senate Bill 310, authored by state Senator Nancy Skinner. She said "SB 310 will help ensure that California juries represent a fair cross-section of our communities. People with felony records have the right to vote in California. There is no legitimate reason why they should be barred from serving on a jury". And in New York ex-felons could also be eligible for jury duty under a bill that has already cleared the Senate and is now awaiting a House vote. I don't - I actually don't have a problem with this, Juan. I think if you have served your time. If you have been rehabilitated and I don't know exactly of the mechanism in place, but the worry is always that people who have been through the system are going to be prejudiced against prosecutors and law enforcement. What do you have to say to that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, then they can be struck from the jury, if they - if that's the case, if that's what they think. I mean, to me the Constitution is not set up for one striking you out. If you've served your time, if you've done your penance then you have a right to have your rights restored. And I think it would be tantamount to cruel and unusual punishment to say, "Oh, you don't - you can't have your rights restored". Now, I will say that, if you're someone who's been convicted of a violent crime, maybe people would say, if you're on a jury for a violent crime, "We don't know about this and we don't feel comfortable". In which case I think the prosecution can strike you.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Do you think it just goes to show how difficult it is to see juries, because everyone ignores jury summons?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No one wants to do jury duty.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: I like jury duty.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Why are we giving felons jury duty, they don't even want it. I can see them wanting the right to vote or if you're the Boston bomber, maybe you want to vote for Bernie behind bars, I can see that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Here we go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But, I mean, no one wants to serve in a jury. So the only people that want this are defense attorneys. Defense attorneys are going to love having ex-cons on juries. It's automatic not guilty. Well anytime a police officer goes to testify on the stand, "I don't think so". Anytime anybody offers any sort of physical evidence, "Oh that was planted". They're not they're biased against law enforcement, they're biased against prosecutors. Prosecutors are the ones that put them behind bars and then they're going to supposed to listen to the prosecutor and be fair?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: If you have a reformed criminal looking at a dirt bag who's done crime - they're going to be more judgmental--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: --dirt bags - stiffened dirt bags--

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: --not always. And if you've made some bad decisions and you have been reformed.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Also, if you're a gang member, OK, and you're on a jury and then you know people outside, you don't think money's going to exchange hands?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh My Gosh.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Come on, Juan, it happens all the time. He acts so innocent.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I just think--

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Jail (ph) members do have permanent address.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: I think that I would be against it until I'm convicted of a crime. And then I want all felons, all the felons - not only that--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The whole pool.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: I want everyone on the jury to have been convicted of the crime that I am up for. Get specific.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: But there is a process called Voir dire where prosecutors and defense attorneys get to question potential jurors and they will excuse you if they think that you have too much a conflict of interest.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But here's a thing. So there's a redemption piece, but also let's say you have served your time, you've paid your debt to society. Now you're back out and you're trying to get your life in order--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, good point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: --and you are going for a job and you're trying to find somebody who will accept you or at least for - to get an apartment, maybe need to figure out a way to get a car, because you got to drive to work. This is what Kim Kardashian was talking like yesterday starting a ride sharing program, so that former felons can have a second chance and make it to their job interview, it's a huge problem. But if they end up getting a job and they're paying taxes, yes, you bet they better go to jury.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wait, I was thinking about, if you're getting a job and your ex- felon you're kind of on thin ice to begin with. And all of a sudden you have to tell your new boss, I'm sorry can I have three weeks off for jury duty.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: They can't fire you, it's jury duty.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I know, but still it doesn't look good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The other thing is. I think this is - this as overall is a really good discussion for America to be having. The one thing that didn't get enough attention it happened sort of quietly in Florida. There was the vote in the state in 2018 to restore voting rights to felons who have served their time except for violent criminals. However, what the state legislature passed and the Governor signed is, "Well, you're not going to be able to do that until you've paid off all of your fines" - and remember if you have a fine, it triples or whatever, as it goes up. So basically it's like another poll tax. So they feel like they - maybe they owe the money, but at this point there's very few of them going to be able to - if you can't get a job you can't pay the (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Yes--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: --yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: You got to jump through some hoops though. I like the idea--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He went to jail.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Well, I think when you get out of jail I don't mind having to petition to get your rights back. But because I think the people vote--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, you're on probation, yes--

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: --responsible people, though, they want - well, you got to do something.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Well, do we believe in redemption in this country or we not?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: I think we do. It is--

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: I think so too.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: And it should definitely--

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: And not all felonies are the same.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: I was just interviewing a guy who was teaching people how to commit a felony a day, if you flip off a horse, that's a felony.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: I do that all the time.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: --become a--

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: You're the felon.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Excuse me, not just horses. Did you ever go to the zoo? I flip them all off.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Why were you interviewing this man?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He's got a book out.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Because he is some of us like flipping off horses. He used sign language.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, I mean he were interviewing him to work for you?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: No. He wrote a book.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She has a TV show and he interviews people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, I didn't realize she was--

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Juan, you've been on my TV show.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I know. I just thought we were doing a job interview. I didn't know.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: I don't flip off horses, I was just kidding it. I do not flip off horses.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: But Jesse on the other hand he's from Philly, so he punches them. "Fan Mail Friday" is next.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: It's "Fan Mail Friday". Let's get to your questions. OK. "What is the last - most recent song you listened to from your own playlist?" Kennedy?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Oh that's a great question. Listening to last night Beastie Boys, "Looking down the barrel of a gun".

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Oh, "Looking down the barrel of a gun". Juan your playlist?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I can't remember the name of the song, but it was something like boys - I love the boys or something--

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: I love the boys. That's from your boys playlist. Jesse?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: "Let's hear for the boys".

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes that's it. That's the song.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Deniece Williams.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I love that song.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: From the Footlosse soundtrack.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Jesse what's in your playlist? I'm looking mine up right now.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't have a playlist. I have Spotify and it's on a shuffle and it's just Top 40, so I don't know what it is.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
